DOCNAME: CASE OF DAĞTEKİN AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Not necessary to examine P1-1;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses (Convention proceedings) - claim dismissed;Costs and expenses (domestic proceedings) - claim dismissed
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE Law no . CARDINAL came into force . LAW law provided the possibility of leasing ORG land to farmers who were in need and who fulfilled certain eligibility criteria ( “ right holders ” ) . In particular , LAW no . CARDINAL provided that those who had been convicted of certain offences were not entitled to benefit from this law ( see paragraph QUANTITY below ) .

CARDINAL . Following the promulgation of PERSON no . CARDINAL , the applicants applied to the Commission that was responsible for the determination of farmers who were eligible to be right holders under the PERSON in question and requested to be provided with land in Ceylanpınar in the south - east of GPE . They were subsequently identified as right holders and leased land from ORG ( Tarım Reformu Genel Müdürlüğü ) ( “ the Directorate General ” ) for an indefinite period on payment of a rent . The applicants earned their living by cultivating these fields .
CARDINAL . On DATE , after conducting a “ security investigation ” , the Directorate General annulled the right holder status of the applicants .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged separate cases with ORG and requested that the decision of DATE be annulled . They maintained that they had paid their rent periodically until DATE . They also contended that there was no valid reason to terminate their lease contract . They maintained in this connection that although criminal proceedings had been initiated against them in DATE for being members of an illegal organisation , namely the ORG ( ORG Party ) , they had all been acquitted of the charges against them .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG requested ORG to submit the documents in respect of the decision dated DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the Directorate General once again to submit further information and the documents in relation to the security considerations of the administration .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG replied that the Minister of Agriculture had refrained from submitting these documents as they concerned the security of the ORG . In this respect , they relied on LAW . The observations of ORG were communicated to the applicants on DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively . According to the Government , the applicants did not submit any observations in reply .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicants ' cases . The court held that the decision dated DATE which annulled the applicants ' right holder status and the refusal of ORG to submit the relevant documents had been in accordance with the domestic legislation . A member of ORG dissented from the judgments of the court , arguing that the administrative authorities had failed to demonstrate the reason for the annulment of the right holder status of the applicants .
CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively ORG upheld the judgments of ORG .
CARDINAL . The first applicant was notified of the decision of ORG on DATE , the second applicant on DATE , and the remaining applicants on DATE .

CARDINAL . According to LAW no . CARDINAL , persons who are convicted of the offences defined in the first Section of the second Part of LAW and in GPE CARDINAL § CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW can not benefit from the distribution of land . LAW CARDINAL of the same PERSON provides that land shall be taken back , had the right holder been convicted of CARDINAL of the offences mentioned in the first paragraph subsequent to the acquisition of land .

LAW no . CARDINAL provides that , in view of the particularities and security of a region and subsequent to obtaining the opinion of the security institutions , ORG is authorised to make amendments in the right holders list prepared by the Commission .

LAW of ORG provides that the Prime Minister or a Minister may refrain from submitting information or documents to an administrative court if the information or documents in question pertain to the security or vital interests of the ORG .
